main event: On December 6, 1957, bright round objects were observed drifting to the southwest near Darrington, Washington.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 1 hour and 15 minutes., The objects were noted to be very bright which raised the possibility of them being Venus., The reports included astro charts that suggested the observed objects might be Venus due to its brightness that year., The report mentioned other possible explanations including balloons, aircraft, and astronomical phenomena., The location was specified as being 6 miles west of Darrington.
sighted object: bright round objects in the sky
witness description: A neighbor reportedly saw the objects.
